commit.message:
configure.in: Check for -Wno-long-long option support and improve handling of warning CFLAGS...

        * configure.in: Check for -Wno-long-long option support and improve
        handling of warning CFLAGS for stages 1 and 2.
        * Makefile.in (WARN_CFLAGS): Move definition to configure.in.
        * configure: Regenerate.

From-SVN: r34156

files.patch:
@@ -1,3 +1,10 @@
+2000-05-24  J. David Anglin  <dave@hiauly.hia.nrc.ca>
+
+	* configure.in: Check for -Wno-long-long option support and improve
+	handling of warning CFLAGS for stages 1 and 2.
+	* Makefile.in (WARN_CFLAGS): Move definition to configure.in.
+	* configure: Regenerate.
+
 Wed May 24 19:37:53 2000  Jeffrey A Law  (law@cygnus.com)
 
 	* gcc.texi: Remove contributor list.  Instead include contrib.texi.

@@ -76,7 +76,7 @@ XCFLAGS =
 TCFLAGS =
 CFLAGS = -g @stage1_warn_cflags@
 BOOT_CFLAGS = -O2 $(CFLAGS)
-WARN_CFLAGS = -W -Wall -Wtraditional -pedantic -Wno-long-long -Wwrite-strings
+WARN_CFLAGS = @stage2_warn_cflags@
 LOOSE_CFLAGS = `echo $(CFLAGS)|sed -e 's/-pedantic//g' -e 's/-Wtraditional//g'`
 # These exists to be overridden by the x-* and t-* files, respectively.
 X_CFLAGS =

@@ -1348,18 +1348,34 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 
+echo $ac_n "checking whether ${CC-cc} accepts -Wno-long-long""... $ac_c" 1>&6
+echo "configure:1353: checking whether ${CC-cc} accepts -Wno-long-long" >&5
+echo 'void f(){}' > conftest.c
+if test -z "`${CC-cc} -Wno-long-long -c conftest.c 2>&1`"; then
+  ac_cv_prog_cc_no_long_long=yes
+else
+  ac_cv_prog_cc_no_long_long=no
+fi
+rm -f conftest*
+echo "$ac_t"$ac_cv_prog_cc_no_long_long 1>&6
+
 # If the native compiler is GCC, we can enable warnings even in stage1.  
 # That's useful for people building cross-compilers, or just running a
 # quick `make'.
+stage1_warn_cflags=" -W -Wall -Wtraditional -Wwrite-strings"
+stage2_warn_cflags="$stage1_warn_cflags -pedantic -Wno-long-long"
 if test "x$GCC" = "xyes"; then 
-  stage1_warn_cflags='$(WARN_CFLAGS)'
+  if test $ac_cv_prog_cc_no_long_long = yes; then
+    stage1_warn_cflags="$stage1_warn_cflags -pedantic -Wno-long-long"
+  fi
 else
   stage1_warn_cflags=""
 fi
 
 
+
 echo $ac_n "checking whether ${MAKE-make} sets \${MAKE}""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1363: checking whether ${MAKE-make} sets \${MAKE}" >&5
+echo "configure:1379: checking whether ${MAKE-make} sets \${MAKE}" >&5
 set dummy ${MAKE-make}; ac_make=`echo "$2" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_prog_make_${ac_make}_set'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
@@ -1387,7 +1403,7 @@ fi
 
 
 echo $ac_n "checking whether a default assembler was specified""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1391: checking whether a default assembler was specified" >&5
+echo "configure:1407: checking whether a default assembler was specified" >&5
 if test x"${DEFAULT_ASSEMBLER+set}" = x"set"; then
     if test x"$gas_flag" = x"no"; then
     	echo "$ac_t""yes ($DEFAULT_ASSEMBLER)" 1>&6
@@ -1399,7 +1415,7 @@ else
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking whether a default linker was specified""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1403: checking whether a default linker was specified" >&5
+echo "configure:1419: checking whether a default linker was specified" >&5
 if test x"${DEFAULT_LINKER+set}" = x"set"; then
     if test x"$gnu_ld_flag" = x"no"; then
 	echo "$ac_t""yes ($DEFAULT_LINKER)" 1>&6
@@ -1416,7 +1432,7 @@ do
 # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_word""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1420: checking for $ac_word" >&5
+echo "configure:1436: checking for $ac_word" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_prog_AWK'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
@@ -1448,7 +1464,7 @@ done

 set dummy flex; ac_word=$2

-echo "configure:1452: checking for $ac_word" >&5
+echo "configure:1468: checking for $ac_word" >&5

   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
@@ -1482,15 +1498,15 @@ then
   *) ac_lib=l ;;
   esac
   echo $ac_n "checking for yywrap in -l$ac_lib""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1486: checking for yywrap in -l$ac_lib" >&5
+echo "configure:1502: checking for yywrap in -l$ac_lib" >&5

   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6

-#line 1494 "configure"
+#line 1510 "configure"

 /* Override any gcc2 internal prototype to avoid an error.  */
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
@@ -1501,7 +1517,7 @@ int main() {
 yywrap()
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:1505: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:1521: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var=yes"
 else
@@ -1524,7 +1540,7 @@ fi
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking whether ln works""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1528: checking whether ln works" >&5
+echo "configure:1544: checking whether ln works" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_prog_LN'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6

@@ -1556,7 +1572,7 @@ else

 echo $ac_n "checking whether ln -s works""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1560: checking whether ln -s works" >&5
+echo "configure:1576: checking whether ln -s works" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_prog_LN_S'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
@@ -1588,19 +1604,19 @@ else
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for volatile""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1592: checking for volatile" >&5
+echo "configure:1608: checking for volatile" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_c_volatile'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6

   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 1597 "configure"
+#line 1613 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"

-if { (eval echo configure:1604: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then

 set dummy ranlib; ac_word=$2
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_word""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1627: checking for $ac_word" >&5
+echo "configure:1643: checking for $ac_word" >&5

@@ -1655,7 +1671,7 @@ do

-echo "configure:1700: checking for a BSD compatible install" >&5
+echo "configure:1716: checking for a BSD compatible install" >&5

   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
@@ -1747,7 +1763,7 @@ test -z "$INSTALL_DATA" && INSTALL_DATA='${INSTALL} -m 644'
 
 
 echo $ac_n "checking how to run the C preprocessor""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1751: checking how to run the C preprocessor" >&5
+echo "configure:1767: checking how to run the C preprocessor" >&5
 # On Suns, sometimes $CPP names a directory.
 if test -n "$CPP" && test -d "$CPP"; then
   CPP=
@@ -1762,13 +1778,13 @@ else

   # not just through cpp.
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 1766 "configure"
+#line 1782 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <assert.h>
 Syntax Error

 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:1772: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:1788: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }

 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   :
@@ -1779,13 +1795,13 @@ else
   rm -rf conftest*
   CPP="${CC-cc} -E -traditional-cpp"
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 1783 "configure"
+#line 1799 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <assert.h>
 Syntax Error
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:1789: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }

 if test -z "$ac_err"; then

@@ -1796,13 +1812,13 @@ else

   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF

 EOF

-{ (eval echo configure:1806: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
